Description: Black-topped red ware globular jar with an inverted rounded rim and a rounded, slightly flattened, base; red-brown fabric, black on the exterior rim and the interior surface, burnished on the exterior. Handmade. Complete but reconstructed with small chips on the rim.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site P37 Grave (G3) Context 23c
Type series: NDRS type B8.1 (published form type series number)
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.299, fig. 5.30)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 1349x (excavation type series number)
